name: Santa in a Dory
short_description: Santa rowing into St. John's harbour.
overview_description:
Santa in a Dory is an original acrylic painting completed in 2020 by Elizabeth Brazil. This piece depicts Santa Claus rowing a Newfoundland dory into St. John's Harbour on Christmas Eve.

Available in standard sizes that fit most off-the-shelf frames, or can be custom framed for a personalized touch. Options include matted or unmatted prints, as well as prints on canvas. Every reproduction is crafted with care by small, locally owned businesses, ensuring high quality and supporting the local community.
detailed_description:
This original painting captures the enchanting moment of Santa Claus rowing a traditional Newfoundland dory through the Narrows into St. John's Harbour on Christmas Eve. Dressed in a classic sou'wester hat, Santa navigates the dark, shimmering waters, ready to deliver presents.

The backdrop is a stunning night sky illuminated by the moon, while the colorful and closely packed jellybean houses of downtown St. John's glow with festive charm. Towering above the whimsical architecture is The Rooms Heritage Museum, an iconic structure that grounds the scene in the heart of Newfoundland's culture.

True to Elizabeth Brazil's signature style, the painting embraces a playful and flowing aesthetic, evident in the exaggerated curves of the waves, the buildings, and even Santa's iconic curly beard. This artwork is a joyous celebration of Newfoundland's holiday traditions and its unique, picturesque charm.
details: Print without matte fits any standard 8 x 10 frame
Print with matte fits any standard 11 x 14 frame

name: Santa Rows Ashore
short_description: Santa rowing into Conception Bay on Christmas Eve.
overview_description: Santa Rows Ashore is an original acrylic painting completed in 2021 by Elizabeth Brazil. This piece depicts Santa rowing his traditional Newfoundland dory into Conception Bay on Christmas Eve, with the moonlight reflecting off the water. Available as 8x10 prints in various formats, including matted options, each reproduction is crafted using locally owned businesses to ensure top quality and community support.
detailed_description:
This enchanting painting captures Santa Claus braving the North Atlantic waters as he rows into Conception Bay on Christmas Eve. Instead of a catch of Atlantic cod, Santa has his trusty bag of toys ready for delivery. The moonlight dances on the ocean's surface, illuminating the steep sea stacks that rise dramatically from the water. These rugged cliffs represent Bell Island, paying homage to Elizabeth Brazil's roots. 

Santa, dressed in his iconic sou'wester hat, is seen navigating the nighttime waters with his dory, creating a magical and serene holiday setting. The detailed textures of the sea stacks and the glowing sky highlight the beauty of Newfoundland's coastal landscape, making this painting a celebration of the province's rugged charm and Christmas spirit.

name: Heritage Santa
short_description: Santa wearing a traditional navigator's hat adorned with NL and Labrador flags.
overview_description: Heritage Santa is an original acrylic painting completed in 2022 by Elizabeth Brazil. This circular artwork features Santa's iconic beard and hat flowing into the ocean surf, a whimsical nod to Newfoundland's maritime heritage. Available as a 16x20 print, it is locally reproduced using vintage printing techniques by small businesses, ensuring both quality and tradition.
detailed_description:
This captivating painting showcases Santa Claus in a circular composition, with his flowing beard seamlessly transforming into the cresting waves of the North Atlantic. Set against the backdrop of a clear, cold northern sky, Santa wears a traditional navigator's hat—a nod to historic explorers of the region. Adding a festive touch, the hat is adorned with mistletoe and proudly features the Newfoundland and Labrador flags, paying homage to both regions of the province.

The original acrylic artwork was designed on a circular canvas and graphically reimagined on a 16x20 white background for easy framing. The text on the print—'NL Heritage Santa' and 'Filled with Wonderment & Wishes at Christmas'—was carefully crafted in a press-style homage by local artist Chris Morrison. This reproduction aligns with traditional printing practices, using a vintage press and the services of a small local business, adding a historic and community-focused charm to the piece.

name: Santa at the Cape
short_description: Santa anchoring at Cape Spear lighthouse on Christmas Eve.
overview_description: Santa at the Cape is an original acrylic painting completed in 2023 by Elizabeth Brazil. This stunning artwork features Santa arriving at Cape Spear, the easternmost point of North America, guided by the historic lighthouse. Available as a 16x20 print, it is locally reproduced using vintage techniques by small businesses, ensuring both quality and tradition.
detailed_description:
This painting portrays Santa Claus navigating the open waters of the Atlantic Ocean to arrive at Cape Spear, Newfoundland, on Christmas Eve. Cape Spear, the easternmost tip of North America, has long been a guiding light for sailors and is the first point of land to see the sunrise on Christmas morning. 

The lighthouse, the oldest surviving lighthouse in Newfoundland, stands as a beacon of hope, guiding mariners home and, on this occasion, helping Santa on his journey to deliver toys. Santa is depicted in a traditional dory, wearing his sou'wester hat, with a bag of toys in tow. The rugged shoreline, battered and shaped by the ocean waves, frames the scene as Santa anchors his boat to the cliffs under the light of a glowing full moon. Waves crash against the cliffs, rocking his dory, evoking the timeless maritime legacy of Newfoundland. 

Cape Spear is a National Historic Site and an enduring symbol of Newfoundland's connection to the sea.

name: Santa's Jellybean Row
short_description: Santa's beard transforms into waves carrying a dory filled with jellybean houses.
overview_description: Santa's Jellybean Row is an original acrylic painting completed in 2023 by Elizabeth Brazil. This vibrant artwork features Santa's whimsical beard flowing into the Atlantic waves, carrying Newfoundland's iconic jellybean houses, a lighthouse, and fishing stages. Available as an 11x14 print, this piece is locally reproduced using high-quality techniques by small businesses, ensuring community-focused craftsmanship.
detailed_description:
Set on a clear, moonlit winter night, this magical painting depicts Santa Claus overlooking a scene of whimsical charm. Santa's iconic beard flows seamlessly into the ocean waves of the Atlantic, which cradle a dory anchored to the beard itself. The dory carries vibrant jellybean rowhouses, a lighthouse, and traditional fishing stages that seem to rise up over the shores of Newfoundland.

The houses glow warmly with their winter fireplaces burning, smoke billowing from the chimneys, creating a cozy holiday feel. This unique composition showcases Newfoundland's colorful architecture and maritime culture, all framed under the light of a full moon. This imaginative and vibrant work is a celebration of community, tradition, and the magic of Christmas in Newfoundland.

name: The Mariner
short_description: A festive mariner encircled by nautical rope and Cape Spear lighthouse.
overview_description: The Mariner is the newest addition to the Seasonal Collection, completed in 2024 by Elizabeth Brazil. This stunning artwork features Santa with a flowing, wavelike beard encircled in a nautical rope wreath adorned with mistletoe and holly. Available as prints in both 8x8 and 12x12 sizes, it is locally reproduced with care by Newfoundland businesses.
detailed_description:
This captivating painting introduces Santa as 'The Mariner,' celebrating Newfoundland's deep maritime traditions. Santa's flowing beard takes the form of ocean waves and is framed by a festive wreath made of nautical rope dotted with mistletoe and holly. His rosy cheeks hint at the cold North Atlantic air, while his traditional sou'wester hat is adorned with mistletoe and bears the Newfoundland and Labrador flags in its brim.

Adding to the charm, the image includes Cape Spear lighthouse, resting against polished beach rocks and an anchor, symbolizing Newfoundland's rich nautical history. The bright and vibrant colors of Santa and his wreath stand out vividly against the calm night sky, creating a joyful yet serene holiday scene. This piece is perfect for celebrating the connection between Christmas and Newfoundland's maritime heritage.

name: The Fiddle Player
short_description: A mummer playing a fiddle in festive spirit.
overview_description: The Fiddle Player is an original acrylic painting completed in 2019 by Elizabeth Brazil. Part of the Mummers Series, this festive piece features a mummer joyfully playing a fiddle, celebrating Newfoundland's rich musical traditions and holiday customs. Available as 8x10 prints in multiple formats, it is locally reproduced by small businesses to ensure high-quality craftsmanship.
detailed_description:
This vibrant painting showcases a traditional Newfoundland mummer joyfully playing a fiddle, a popular folk instrument known for its role in jigs, reels, and festive music. The mummer is dressed in fishing waders, with their face hidden by fabric, honoring the mummering tradition of disguising oneself during Christmastime. A playful detail includes a handkerchief tucked into the waders' pocket, adorned with the Newfoundland flag, adding a local touch to the piece.

Set against a whimsical and festive backdrop, the artwork celebrates Newfoundland's unique blend of music and culture. The fiddle, central to this scene, highlights the province's instrumental music heritage, often heard during Christmas celebrations and community gatherings.
details: 8x10 matted print fits any standard 11x14 frame

name: Santa's Mummers
short_description: Santa's flowing beard filled with playful mummers and traditional instruments.
overview_description: Santa's Mummers is an original acrylic painting completed in 2019 by Elizabeth Brazil. This festive piece captures Santa with his iconic beard full of whimsical mummers, celebrating Newfoundland's rich holiday and musical traditions. Available as a 16x20 print, this piece is locally reproduced to ensure exceptional quality and craftsmanship.
detailed_description:
This imaginative painting features Santa Claus with a flowing, wispy beard teeming with Newfoundland mummers. Each mummer is dressed in traditional concealing attire, adding a playful nod to Newfoundland's cherished mummering tradition. The lively scene includes mummers hanging lights, swinging, and playing traditional folk instruments such as the ugly stick, spoons, accordion, guitar, fiddle, and bodhrán drum.

Santa himself wears a sou'wester hat, paying homage to Newfoundland's maritime heritage, while the subtle background suggests an aerial view of white-capped ocean waves. This piece celebrates the vibrant, joyful spirit of Newfoundland's holiday traditions, blending music, culture, and the playful charm of mummering into a truly unique holiday depiction.

Each painting in this limited series of ten is unique, offering collectors the chance to own a one-of-a-kind artwork. Handmade using sewn canvas and painted in acrylic, it features Santa in a traditional folk art style, carrying his bag of toys in one hand and a lantern in the other. The ornament is supported by a reclaimed wood base and stuffed with cotton for durability and charm.
